message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you this incredible product that I think you'll really love. I'm willing to start the negotiation at $1500000. Is this something you'd like to consider?
Alice, I appreciate your offer, but I'm looking to pay a bit less for this product. I'm willing to offer $1200000. Let's see if we can come to a mutually beneficial agreement.

Thank you for your offer, Bob. I appreciate your interest in the product. However, I was thinking more along the lines of $1400000. I'm willing to meet you halfway, but I need to make sure I get a good deal for my product.

Alice,  $1400000 is still a bit high for me. I'm willing to go up to $1300000. This is a fair price that reflects the value of the product and allows both of us to make a good deal.  What do you think?

I understand you're trying to get a good deal, Bob, but I'm not willing to go as low as $1300000. I'm willing to meet you halfway between our previous offers, so I'm thinking of $1350000. This is my best and final offer on this round.
Alice, I appreciate you coming down in price.  I'm still not quite there.  $1325000 is the highest I can go at this point.  If you're serious about making a deal, let's close it here.

I appreciate your persistence, Bob, but I'm starting to think we're getting close to my minimum acceptable price. I'm willing to meet you halfway between $1325000 and my previous offer of $1350000, so I'm thinking of $1337500. This is my last offer before I start to get concerned that we might not be able to come to an agreement.
